# pyproject.toml
used for:
* pypi/pip installations
* pyswift projects
* buildozer/android projects

```toml
# Generated by UV
[project]
name = "app"
version = "0.1.0"
description = "Add your description here"
readme = "README.md"
authors = [
    { name = "Joe", email = "joe@drunkenjoe.com" }
]
requires-python = ">=3.11.11"
dependencies = [
    "kivy",
    "kivymd>=1.2.0",
    "pillow==11.0.0",
    "pydantic==2.11.0",
    "supabase==2.16.0",
    "trio>=0.30.0",
]

[dependency-groups]
iphoneos = [
    "admob4kivy",
    "pyobjus",
]
macos = [
    "pyobjus",
]
# when android starts having wheels
android = [
    "admob4kivy",
    "pyjnius==1.4.0",
]

[tool.uv.sources]
admob4kivy = { git = "https://github.com/KivySwiftPackages/Admob4Kivy" }



[build-system]
requires = ["hatchling"]
build-backend = "hatchling.build"



########################################################################################################
########################################################################################################


###### PySwift iOS / macOS Xcode related ######
[pyswift]
# PySwift project configuration
project.name = "MyApp"
project.platforms = ["ios", "macos"]
project.folder_name = "MyApp-Apple"
#project.swift_main.ios = "main-ios.swift" # override default ios main.swift
project.swift_sources = [
    "swift_files",
] # where to find the swift files to add to the project Sources group
project.pip_install_app = false
project.backends = [
    "SDL2",
    "a4k-pyswift",
] # SDL2 will download/add the xcframeworks

# pips that doesnt exist on PyPI, but exist on PySwift
project.dependencies.pips = [
    "ios"
]

[swift-packages]
PyCoreBluetooth = { version = "0.1.0", url = "", libraries = ["PyCoreBluetooth"], py_modules = [".pycorebluetooth"] }




########################################################################################################
########################################################################################################


#### Android / Buildozer related ####
[buildozer-app]
# Buildozer configuration for Android
title = "MyApp"

# buildozer/android only requirements that isnt part of pypi and example is recipe based
requirements = [
    "python3",
    "a4k_pyjnius" # add a4k_pyjnius from recipes
]
android.api = 31
android.minapi = 21
android.sdk = "30"
android.ndk = "21b"
android.arch = "arm64-v8a"
android.private_storage = true
android.permissions = [
    "INTERNET",
    "ACCESS_NETWORK_STATE",
    "WRITE_EXTERNAL_STORAGE",
    "READ_EXTERNAL_STORAGE",
]

# Java source directory
android.add_src = "./java_code" # make it as dependency recipe instead

# AdMob App ID (Test ID shown below; replace with your own production ID)
android.meta_data = "com.google.android.gms.ads.APPLICATION_ID=ca-app-pub-3940256099942544~3347511713"
android.enable_androidx = true

# Required AdMob + Firebase Ads SDK
android.gradle_dependencies = "com.google.android.gms:play-services-ads:22.6.0,com.google.firebase:firebase-ads:21.4.0"


[buildozer]
```

# result for buildozer.spec:

```ini
[app]
title = MyApp
android.api = 31
android.minapi = 21
android.sdk = 30
android.ndk = 21b
android.arch = arm64-v8a
android.private_storage = True
android.permissions = INTERNET, ACCESS_NETWORK_STATE, WRITE_EXTERNAL_STORAGE, READ_EXTERNAL_STORAGE
android.add_src = ./java_code
android.meta_data = com.google.android.gms.ads.APPLICATION_ID=ca-app-pub-3940256099942544~3347511713
android.enable_androidx = True
android.gradle_dependencies = com.google.android.gms:play-services-ads:22.6.0,com.google.firebase:firebase-ads:21.4.0
requirements = python3, a4k_pyjnius, kivy, kivymd>=1.2.0, pillow==11.0.0, pydantic==2.11.0, supabase==2.16.0, trio>=0.30.0, admob4kivy, pyjnius==1.4.0
```
